data.title: Gates Of Dalhalla
data.text:
rEvolver Film Company

Specializes in the production of prestigious cutting edge Music Videos, TV-Productions and Photography.

rEvolver has grown to become the leading music video production company setting industry standards for quality and innovation.

rEVOLVER.SEphone +46 708 557 357

e-mail: revolver@revolver.se

www.revolver.se

We strives to provide unique creative production packages tailored to the marketing and budgetary needs of its clients.

We are a full-service production company.We represents, award winning director Patric Ullaeus. The company serve as a platform from which his directing, filming and photography services are offered.

Patric Ullaeus has more than 2.500.000.000 views of his work on YouTube and is one of the most prominent contemporary music video directors of today. His cinematic styles, vivid imagination and fervent vision have taken him around the world working with a lot of talented artists.

Ullaeus has been honored with several domestic and international awards for excellence in filmmaking including Spellemann Awards, Swedish Metal Awards, Golden Gods Awards, Grammis, Clip among others.

"The man, the myth, the concept...

Patric Ullaeus always deliver!!!"Anders Fridén, IN FLAMES"When it comes to the visuals, he’s our man. When I think that I want us to look like a million dollars, I think of Patric."Gus G, OZZY OSBOURNE & FIREWIND"We immediately felt that we needed some sort of storyline that would graphically show the frustration of the main character in the song. We knew that the director who could make this happen was Patric Ullaeus"Tom S Englund, EVERGREY"It was a very enjoyable shoot and the visuals work great with the music – Patric Ullaeus is the man!”

Michael Amott, ARCH ENEMY"We worked with Patric Ullaeus who has a big name in the scene, producing videos for many great metal acts. We are very satisfied with the end result and we look forward to share the video with all of you” Morten Veland, SIRENIA

© Copyright 2020 Patric Ullaeus. All Rights Reserved.

The content on this website is owned, controlled or licensed by or to RMV AB. Its licensors/or its clients, is protected by copyright, and other right laws. By accessing or using any part of this site you agree that you have read, understand and agree to be bound to these terms. If you do not agree to be so bound, do not access or use this site.GDPR

rEvolver Film Company AB

Privacy Policy. Policy concerning privacy, marketing and processing of personal data. This is version 1.0 of the policy, last updated on 2018-05-22.

This policy sets out how rEvolver Film Company AB AB, Corporate Registration Number 556562-972, Visiting address : Privatvägen 1, Molndal, Sweden, email patric@rEvolver.se, (hereafter “rEvolver”, "we") gather, use, disclose and store your personal data.

rEvolver is a production company producing pictures and films. Working with rEvolver means that clients automatically approve the usage of that material for marketing on rEvolver, Patric Ullaeus websites or YouTube, Vimeo, Instagram, Twitter sites. If you do not approve you have to specially inform that to Patric Ullaeus.

Purpose

We care about your privacy. This is why we have drawn up this policy. It is based on current personal data protection legislation and clarifies how we work to protect your rights and your privacy.

The purpose of the policy is for you to know how we process your personal data, what we use it for, who it may be disclosed to and under what circumstances, and how you can protect your rights.

Why do we process your personal data?

We process your personal data primarily to fulfil our obligations in your respect, for example delivering goods and/or services that you have ordered. Our basic premise is to not process more personal data than is necessary. For the most part we process your personal data for the purposes of:

— Fulfilling our obligations towards you as a customer, such as carrying through purchases, invoicing and the provision of service and support

— Enabling general customer care and customer service, such as responding to questions

—Marketing ourselves and our products via e-mail, SMS/MMS, post and telephone

—Providing you with relevant information and newsletters and on the internet

—Enabling communication with you via post, e-mail, telephone or SMS/MMS

— Enabling personal offers, marketing and event invitations via telephone, post, e-mail and SMS/MMS

—Providing special offers

— Following legal instruments, for example accounting legislature

What personal data do we process?

We only process personal data when we have legal grounds to do so. We do not process personal data in cases other than when it is needed to fulfil legal and contractual obligations. We process no sensitive personal data without your consent. Here are some examples of the personal data we process:

— Name — Address —E-mail address —Telephone number — Title — Information that you have voluntarily supplied and registered in, for example, e-mail conversations

Pictures or footage (film)

For how long do we retain your information?

We save your personal data for up to seven years after your most recent purchase, or latest contact with us. We do this to fulfil our obligations under the Accounting Act and to provide you with service and support for the products you purchased from us. We do not, however, automatically remove you from our newsletters, as you yourself have the opportunity to opt-out at any time (via a link at the bottom of the page in every transmission) if you so wish.

How do we gain access to your personal data?

To the greatest extent possible possible we try to gain your consent before we process your personal data. We do this by allowing you to complete explicit consent clauses in cases where processing of personal data is based on consent. Additionally we gain access to your personal data in the following ways:

— Data that you supply us with directly

—Data we receive from public registries and registers

— Data we receive when you use the services of one of our partners

— Data we receive when you sign up for our newsletters

— Data we receive when you respond to surveys and questionnaires

— Data we receive when you contact us, apply for employment with us,

visit us or otherwise contact us

_ Filming or photographing you

Legal basis for processing your personal data

rEvolver bases the processing of your personal data on a number of legal foundations:

— To the greatest extent possible possible we try to gain your consent before we process your personal data. We do this by allowing you to complete explicit consent clauses in cases where processing of personal data is based on consent

— In order to be able to fulfil our contractual obligations to you as a customer, for example delivering products you have ordered and contacting you with important product updates. Based on this legal foundation we also process data concerning your purchases.

— An amount of the processing of personal data that we do is based on an assumption of your interests This may, for example, imply that the processing we do in order to send you offers on our services.

— We also process your personal data due to legal obligations. This means, for example, data we need in order to fulfil the requirements of the Accounting Act

Profiling

rEvolver can process your personal data through profiling if you are a newsletter subscriber.

You may at any time raise objections to processing of personal data by contacting us at patric@rEvolver.se

Your rights

You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. We will subsequently no longer process your personal data or gather new data, on the condition that it is not required to fulfil our legal or contractual obligations. Keep in mind that withdrawal of consent may imply that we cannot fulfil any obligations we may have in respect of you. When erasing your personal data we cannot verify purchases from us made by you.

You have the right to:

— Request a register abstract of the personal data we have about you. —Request correction of your personal data. — Request that we erase your personal data. This is only possible if the data is no longer necessary for the purposes it was gathered for. There may be legal requirements preventing us from immediately erasing your personal data, for example due to accounting legislation. In such cases we will ensure that your personal data is only processed for the purpose(s) required.

Please contact us at patric@rEvolver.se in order to request a register abstract, a correction or erasure of your personal data.

Is your personal data being processed in a safe manner?

We establish procedures and working methods for your personal data to be processed in a safe and secure manner. The basis is that only employees and those individuals within our organisation who need the personal data in order to carry out their work tasks shall have access to it.

Our security systems are developed with focus on privacy and afford a very high level of protection against intrusion, erasure and other alterations that may imply a risk to your privacy.

We do not transfer personal data in cases other than those expressly stated in this Policy.

When do we disclose your personal data?

Our premise is not to disclose your personal data to third parties unless you have consented to it, or if it is not necessary in order to fulfil our legal or contractual obligations. In cases where we do disclose personal data to third parties, we establish personal data privacy agreements, and ensure that personal data is processed in a safe manner. We will not sell on your personal data to any third party.

Personal Data Controller

rEvolver Film Company AB is the Personal Data Controller, which implies that we are responsible for how your personal data is processed and how your rights are maintained.

Questions? Please contact us at patric@rEvolver.se if you have any questions concerning our processing of your personal data.
